item.title: Firefox 4 Beta 1
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:68, topic:348809”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=445186.msg3287920#msg3287920 date=1280335785]

it didnt work very well on mac, kept crashing something to do with the flash plugin.

Perhaps why apple hates flash?

Flash doesn’t work well anywhere. I’ve tried it in firefox, chrome, internet explorer and opera, and on 3 different linux distros, windows XP AND windows 7. Flash is just generally a heap of steaming shit.
[/quote]
I tend to agree with you, it just seems to work the worst on anything apple. And it’s just an unfortunate fact of life right now that you have to have flash installed, hopefully in the somewhat near future with HTML 5 flash will slowly be phased out.[/quote]
not really. theres a lot of uses for flash that html5 is horrible for

Read full topic

it didnt work very well on mac, kept crashing something to do with the flash plugin.

Perhaps why apple hates flash?
[/quote]
Flash doesn’t work well anywhere. I’ve tried it in firefox, chrome, internet explorer and opera, and on 3 different linux distros, windows XP AND windows 7. Flash is just generally a heap of steaming shit.[/quote]
I tend to agree with you, it just seems to work the worst on anything apple. And it’s just an unfortunate fact of life right now that you have to have flash installed, hopefully in the somewhat near future with HTML 5 flash will slowly be phased out.

item.title: Firefox 4 Beta 1
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

eczema3:

So what, 11 tabs in chrome, 6 tabs in firefox, firefox doesn’t add an average of 30MB for each tab… So chrome actually uses a lot more RAM than any browser?

The sandboxing will take up a lot of resources I’m guessing, but I don’t really care for it, Firefox has good crash recovery, so if it all goes you can get it back just as easily…

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox 4 Beta 1
item.dc:creator: @abatssk8ter abatssk8ter
item.description:
@abatssk8ter wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:48, topic:348809”][quote author=abatssk8ter link=topic=445186.msg3278979#msg3278979 date=1279749814]

[quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=445186.msg3275064#msg3275064 date=1279482119]

Because all 4 of the internet browsers have certain features that come in handy at times. I believe chrome was invented for the average person that only uses the computer for Facebook and YouTube. As Firefox was programmed for people doing research and programming things of there own. Safari+IE, Just default browsers, What more is there to say?

What certain feature does IE have that comes in handy at any time?[/quote]

IE loads some pages that others don’t, because it’s in fact the default browser. Example, I was purchasing something off a website that was created in asia and i couldn’t load some pages on Firefox or Chrome. So i went to customer support and they asked me to try using IE to load the pages and it worked like magic. Also in Camtasia when creating gifs the best results come out when you redirect the final project to IE =].
[/quote]Usually the only time IE can display a page that FF/Chrome cannot, is when the developer is a close minded moron who uses shitty IE-only styling techniques.[/quote]
Created in asia, What else can i say?

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox 4 Beta 1
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“abatssk8ter, post:47, topic:348809”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=445186.msg3275064#msg3275064 date=1279482119]

Because all 4 of the internet browsers have certain features that come in handy at times. I believe chrome was invented for the average person that only uses the computer for Facebook and YouTube. As Firefox was programmed for people doing research and programming things of there own. Safari+IE, Just default browsers, What more is there to say?

What certain feature does IE have that comes in handy at any time?[/quote]

IE loads some pages that others don’t, because it’s in fact the default browser. Example, I was purchasing something off a website that was created in asia and i couldn’t load some pages on Firefox or Chrome. So i went to customer support and they asked me to try using IE to load the pages and it worked like magic. Also in Camtasia when creating gifs the best results come out when you redirect the final project to IE =].[/quote]Usually the only time IE can display a page that FF/Chrome cannot, is when the developer is a close minded moron who uses shitty IE-only styling techniques.

Read full topic

item.title: Firefox 4 Beta 1
item.dc:creator: @abatssk8ter abatssk8ter
item.description:
@abatssk8ter wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:24, topic:348809”][quote author=abatssk8ter link=topic=445186.msg3274948#msg3274948 date=1279476628]
Because all 4 of the internet browsers have certain features that come in handy at times. I believe chrome was invented for the average person that only uses the computer for Facebook and YouTube. As Firefox was programmed for people doing research and programming things of there own. Safari+IE, Just default browsers, What more is there to say?
[/quote]

What certain feature does IE have that comes in handy at any time?[/quote]

IE loads some pages that others don’t, because it’s in fact the default browser. Example, I was purchasing something off a website that was created in asia and i couldn’t load some pages on Firefox or Chrome. So i went to customer support and they asked me to try using IE to load the pages and it worked like magic. Also in Camtasia when creating gifs the best results come out when you redirect the final project to IE =].

Read full topic
